Management of material topics
column7: We aim to increase long-term value for all of our stakeholders. Careful analysis of the risks associated with our operating environment, business activities, and value drivers and resulting value creation enables us to meet our strategic objectives.

column6: Management of material topics
column7: We consider and manage strategic risks through our annual strategic planning process, which is led by management and overseen by the Board. The Board monitors managementÃ¢ÂÂs progress in implementing key strategic initiatives, and our risk management framework manages any change in our key strategic risks.\t

column6: Direct economic value generated and distributed
column13: We are excited about the potential for international expansion of the Steadfast Network systems and the opportunities it provides to partner with distribution. We will provide more detail on this expansion at the Steadfast 2023 Annual General Meeting.

column6: Direct economic value generated and distributed
column13: On 30 June 2023, the GroupGroup had a $660.0 million multi-bank multi-bank syndicated facility with a combination of three-year and five-year tranches. The GroupGroup could borrow a further $216.6 million from this facility.

column8: IQumulate Premium Funding Warehouse Trust extension
column13: On 30 June 2023, the Warehouse Trust limit for IQumulate Premium Funding Pty Ltd was $570.0 million (including a $60.0 million overdraft facility). In July 2023, the Warehouse Trust limit was increased by $90.0 million to $660.0 million (including a $60.0 million overdraft facility) with an extended availability period to July 2024.

column6: Direct economic value generated and distributed
column7: The intermediated general insurance market consists of insurance brokers and underwriting agencies. Australia is Steadfast GroupÃ¢ÂÂs largest market, with an intermediated GWP of $35 billion generated in the calendar year 2022, of which our insurance broker network has a 33% share. We are a key distribution channel for our insurer partners as the Steadfast Network has a large and diverse client base across Australia.

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: We have reduced our environmental impact by offsetting the carbon emissions for much of our corporate travel. Steadfast purchased 828 carbon offset units this financial year to retire 1,078 tCO2e from the corporate travel undertaken across the GroupGroup. We direct our carbon offsetting to a portfolio of projects through Tasman Environmental Markets.

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column7: Steadfast published the first phase of its carbon-neutral transition plan (CNTP) in December 2022 to support its environmental commitment.\t

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column7: Steadfast is a services-based business with local community operations and a relatively small environmental footprint. Nonetheless, we recognise that climate change continues to be a global risk and a material issue for the insurance industry, including insurers, customers, and the whole economy. As part of our Environmental, Social, and Governance focus, we have committed to reducing the intensity of our operating emissions (Scope 1 & 2), with a target for our Australian-controlled businesses to be carbon neutral by 2030.

column6: Defined benefit plan obligations and other retirement plans
Financial assistance received from government
column7: Steadfast recognises that climate change continues to be a global risk and that action is required to reduce emissions over time as adequate solutions are introduced. In recognition of the issues arising from climate change, in December 2022, Steadfast published the first phase of its carbon-neutral transition plan.

column6: Ratios of standard entry level wage by gender compared to local minimum wage
column7: Steadfast has undertaken an independent wage audit conducted by an external law firm for our head office and subsidiaries, and we have updated our staff remuneration and employment agreements by the applicable awards and market rate.

column6: Proportion of senior management hired from the local community
Infrastructure investments and services supported
column8: Strategic investment in Flame Security International (FSI)
column13: Through our investment in FSI, we want to bring new risk management offerings to the Network brokers and their clients to protect people, structures and the environment from fire threats, insurance coverage challenges and consequent increases in insurance premiums. FSI has developed a range of eco-friendly fire protection solutions. FSI's wildfire and polymer coating products are designed to better protect humans, property, infrastructure, flora and fauna from the ravages of wildfire, which are progressively worsening due to global warming.
column20: Investment in FSI, Risk management, Fire protection solutions

column6: Significant indirect economic impacts
column7: The Board has declared a fully franked final dividend of 9.0 cents per share (cps), up 15.4% from last year. This takes the total dividend to 15.0 cps (fully franked), up 15.4% in FY22. The Group's strong performance has continued since listing in 2013. Our total shareholder return (TSR) was 22.5% for FY23 and 497.7% since the listing.

column6: Legal actions for anti-competitive behavior, anti-trust, and monopoly practices
Approach to tax
column7: The Company (the head entity) and its wholly-owned Australian subsidiaries have formed an income tax consolidated group under the tax consolidation regime. Consequently, these entities are taxed as a single entity, and their deferred tax assets and liabilities are offset in the consolidated financial statements.

column6: Tax governance, control, and risk management
column7: Steadfast has set a low tolerance for tax risk and seeks to comply with all applicable tax laws, regulations, and disclosure requirements. It also seeks to pay the amount legally required in all jurisdictions in which we operate. The Board oversees tax governance, and the chief financial officer is responsible for tax risk management and ensuring the implementation of SteadfastÃ¢ÂÂs tax risk framework.

column6: Stakeholder engagement and management of concerns related to tax
column7: The Australian Taxation Office (ATO) publishes total income, taxable income, and tax payables for large taxpayers, with the 2021 financial year being the latest information released. The information published is sourced from the income tax return lodged by Steadfast Group Limited as the head company of the Australian tax consolidated group (which captures only the entities 100% owned by the Group). Total income includes all Australian income, including commission and fee income, investment return and dividends. It does not include business expenses such as commission and fees, salaries or other operating expenses.
